intro: Urtica scabrella, commonly known as the stinging nettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Urticaceae family. It is characterized by its hollow, hairless stems and heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant contains fine,螫性 (stinging) hairs that release histamine and other irritants when touched, causing a painful rash. Urtica scabrella thrives in moist, fertile soils and is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and disturbed areas. It is also known for its nutritional value, containing high levels of protein, vitamins, and minerals.
